intro: Stackhousia pulvinaris f. intermedia, commonly known as the intermedia form of the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and large, showy flowers. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape, with a rough texture and prominent venation. This form is distinguished by its slightly different growth habit and floral characteristics compared to the typical variety. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
